issue.title: Add wayland dark themed client decorations option
issue.body:
Adds the option to set the wayland client side decorations theme to a dark one. The colors in the theme are changeable but I chose colors that in my opinion look good on the ConceptFrame. Once a new winit and SCTK version has been released then this PR can be considered merge-able. 

I don't really know that much about alacritty's configuration process so please tell me if I missed something. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40879396/51912350-11028d00-240f-11e9-9bfa-aa56c06e26ca.png)

Fixes https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/issues/2092.

body: Usually pull requests aren't considered duplicates of issues.
Yeah, this is the tracking issue for the PR. The PR might be closed or disappear for some other reason, but this issue is used to track the feature itself, not just one implementation process.

issue.title: Make the window decorations nicer
issue.body:
Given that Gnome on Wayland probably isn't getting server-side-decorations (https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/mutter/issues/217, :man_facepalming:), the window decorations provided by Alacritty should be nicer - I don't have any particular style in mind, but I think they could use some work.

To be clear - the current ones are functionally perfectly OK, I'm talking about appearance only.

Spin-off from #2860

issue.title: dark title bar on Linux (wayland) not working
issue.body:
even using 'gtk_theme_variant: dark' the title bar always remains white.

### System

OS: Linux
Version: 0.4.1
Linux/BSD: Wayland, Gnome
